data.title: Clear text field after creating folder in project manager
data.body: When creating a project, if you press the button "create folder", the "Name" textbox contains the text you entered previously... so if you create two folders one after the other you have to delete the text you entered previously to enter your new text.

data.title: [Bug] GDScript: Causing a call to a setter within the setter crashes Godot
data.body:
If I do something like this:

```
var percentage setget set_percentage

func set_percentage(new_percentage):
    self.percentage = clamp(new_percentage, -1.0, 1.0)
```

The setter calls himself again. This causes a hard crash. What I'd expect: An GDScript exception with Godot pointing to the evil line.

![godotcrash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1672238/7127919/71943876-e24b-11e4-81f4-6e4db6c0164a.png)

data.title: Godot crashes if no sound is available on Windows/RtAudio
data.body:
On my computer it happened in all versions I use return, and the old and in the new version, I had thought that this problem only on my computer, but it appeared to others as well.
Collapse occurs at the moment when there is a start-up scene from the editor, also the collapse happens when I run the project from the project manager, or start a game from the project manager immediately, and also the project manager sometimes collapse too.
But of course, most often fall when trying to run the scene play, because this action, I often repeat when working on the script, it takes place as follows ...
1) I am submitting an amendment to the script or scene, and I press the button "play the current scene" to see how it works ...
2) The process starts to boot and there is a blank window which should start the game further with probability 60% -70%, there is a crash, and my Windows tells me that the program has ceased its operation for unknown reasons, and proposes close window the scene, but that editor itself is working on.
3) I try to start the scene again, try again, and again it failed, so there may be several times in a row.
4) between the start attempts, I have not changed anything anywhere, I just press on the "start this scene" again, and finally the scene starts, (but when I finally manage to start the the scene, I can not even remember what I wanted there find out ...).
This situation is very, very frustrating, it reduces the efficiency very much and makes work in hell ...

data.title: Post-Import script : needs to import twice before scripts changes are takken in consideration
data.body:
Hi,

Thanks for having fixed #1668. But now I've found an other strange behavior with current head.

I import a 3d scene by making use of a Post-Import script that is still WIP.

Each time I make a change to the script, I save it carefully and I re-import the 3D scene just after to test the changes.

The problem is that the latest changes I've made to the post-script are not immediately taken in consideration. I have to "import and open" a second time.

data.title: A possible scope problem
Inconsistent support for user:// vs res:// directory operations
data.body:
Windows 7 64 bit, beta 1.1.

1) Globals.globalize_path does not expand user:// references.  The C++ code only checks for res:// and does not expand user://.   A mostly cosmetic issue but it should be consistent.
2) Directory.make_dir does not create directories in user://.  Exact same code works fine if I change user:// to res://

There may be other cases, these are the two I hit.  

Impact, I can't find a way to create a subdirectory under user:// since I can't globalize it and make_dir does not expand it.

It could be nice to do collision exception with a group.

Thanks.

data.title: Alt + F4 doesn't close the editor on GNU/Linux
data.body: When you press Alt + F4, the exit confirmation will appear, but once you click Quit, the editor will not exit. This can be reproduced several times.

data.title: Closing game while popup active causes crash
data.body:
Running on windows 7 64 bit, godot 1.1beta1 (also is present in 1.0 stable).  Simple project setup of:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4614207/7106676/a0af00d0-e117-11e4-838d-c9986da28195.png)

with a script of:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4614207/7106686/b73d7df4-e117-11e4-9b39-1457a196a935.png)

After activating the popup, closing the program using the windows X quit button results in a crash showing this in console:

EXEC PATHP: d:\kbd\src\godot\godot_win64-1.1beta1.exe
EXEC PATHP: d:\kbd\src\godot\godot_win64-1.1beta1.exe
opening pack d:\kbd\src\godot\godot_win64-1.1beta1.exe, -1, -1
opening pack D:/kbd/src/Godot/bugs/popup_quit_crash/data.pck, -1, -1
DETECTED MONITORS: 2
shit?: No error

data.title: Font import fails when project on d drive
data.body:
Problem - fonts only import if project is located on C: drive.  This was present in 1.0 and is still an issue in 1.1.

To reproduce:
1) Create a new project on the D: drive
2) Import>Font
3) Set source path to c:/windows/Fonts/times.ttf by browsing with the .. button and selecting times.ttf. 
4) Set dest to test.fnt
5) Click import - gives "Couldn't save font" error and this is shown in console:
loadfrom: c:/Windows/Fontstimes.ttf
FT_Stream_Open: could not open `c:/Windows/Fontstimes.ttf'

(Note the missing delimiter between Fonts and times.ttf)

Repeat above but create the project on the C: drive
5) Click import - font imports successfully and following is shown in console:
loadfrom: C:/Windows/Fonts/times.ttf
W: 3 P: 3
W: 5 P: 5
...
total_chars: 191
Atlas size: 256,256

Note this issue is also mentioned by someone else in http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1615 .

data.title: Code Completion hint stays open until I click
data.body: When a code completion hint shows up it will stay up until I either click or get another hint which then stays on screen.

data.title: Input action constantly pressed
data.body:
I'm making a game in android and I've noticed the input action get "stucked" when reloading the scene.

I'm using the "global.gd" technic to reload the scene.

``` gdscript
func goto_scene(scene):
    # remove current scene from root and enqueue it for deletion
    # (when deleted, it will be removed)
    current_scene.queue_free()

    # load and add new scene to root
    var s = ResourceLoader.load(scene)
    current_scene = s.instance()
    get_tree().get_root().add_child(current_scene)
```

I use touchbuttons to control the character. On PC it works ok, but in Android if you reload the scene while holding down the touch for a button, the action is still pressed and the character walks constantly.

I don't know if this also happens in iOS or other touchscreen devices

data.title: Unable to overwrite files
data.body:
I recently learned about Godot and tried following the first tutorial. However, I was unable to do the simplest things and after a bit of investigation the problem seems to be that for some reason Godot is unable to overwrite scene and script files after they have been initially created. The .tmp files for those are created and updated, but the original file remains as it was upon creation. The command prompt window keeps showing the following message when I try to save a file in Godot:

ERROR: close: Condition ' rename_error ' is true.
At: drivers/windows/file_access_windows.cpp:133

I am running this under Windows XP with Service Pack 3.

data.title: Lighting Broke in Demos. hash b36e41cb7117757011e6f1ccc476ccc806219a58
data.body:
Surface 2 Pro I5 Intel Graphics Chipset.. Windows 8.

Problem seen in Kinematic_Char and Platformer. Tile blocks look black. When you turn off Mipmapping the textures become visible again.

data.title: Access CollisionShape nodes at runtime
data.body: I know I can use  add_shape and remove_shape to do this, but CollisionPolygon2D only allowed to be edit in editor tool and I can not save my draw to a Resource, so I have no idea how to get the Shape2D for add_shape.

data.title: Reading lines from a text file crippled text, with no Latin letters
data.body:
When you try to read a text file which has a large text of letters, all read well, but if in the middle of the text, one character is not the Latin alphabet, then it may happen that two options I found
1) all of the text is empty,
2) tex is not empty but in a place where non-Latin character appears several different characters and half of the text of the entire text is not present
if not added at the end of a Latin symbol, the text after that character is lost, the option "1)" occurs when more than one character in the middle of the text, as well as in the case of certain characters in the middle of this example, ""

data.title: "Invalid/Broken Script for Post-Import" dialog box refuses to "Accept"
data.body:
Hi,

Latest compiled version.

Clicking on the "Accept" button of the "Invalid/Broken Script for Post-Import" dialog box has no effect, even if the script was debugged.

This dialog box appears when trying to re-import again.

![godot_20150410_2016_post_import_dialog_refuses_to_accept](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/7094059/a88bc518-dfbe-11e4-988a-4d881eab1cd0.png)

data.title: Now the script editor highlight all lines of a multiline string
RichTextLabel option to forced line break before long words that would escape the label area
data.body:
If a word in the Rich Text Label too long, longer than the width of the frame and without spaces, a part which overlooks beyond the bounds is not transferred to the new line of forcibly, and it is as it is impossible to read. But now I'm important that it is transferred, even if the word is very long and without spaces.
But I also think that it is important to keep both features, because I can see how one would apply and such an effect that is there now, and it is therefore possible solution is to make the function toggle between which you can switch including forced transfer of long words, and turn it off.
Thank U!

data.title: Visual Shader Editor; Reminder on issue of case where shaders may break
data.body:
All that you need to know is right here
https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/1427

With Godot in beta, it would be nice to get this fixed for good.

data.title: GDscript function "free()" doesn't show up in the built-in help nor the auto-complete
data.body:
So I know now that it's a real function, but you might not get the impression it is because the auto-complete doesn't have it when you start typing it and searching for it in the built-in help doesn't give any results.

Right now, with _remove_and_delete_child()_ gone, people might otherwise end up wondering if there's no way to remove individual nodes in Godot.

Should be an easy one to fix.

data.title: Bug with side scroll bar in the script tab of the editor
data.body:
Built on 07 April 2015
OS: Fedora 21

The side scroll bar within the script tab of the editor seems to have a limit at 70 columns even when the code line is longer. You can only access columns > 70 if you mark and drag the code with the mouse or by maximizing the window.
When maximizing, the side-scroll bar disappears completely. If the code line is bigger then the screen, you have to use above mentioned method with the mouse.
Little demo video:
https://youtu.be/eaTYeD1iIws

data.title: clipping error with Tree control and stretch_mode=2D stretch_aspect=keep
data.body:
Hi,

This is not a new bug. I get it since before 1.0RC1.

The `Tree` control node is not clipped correctly when the window is resized with `stretch_mode=2D` and `stretch_aspect=keep`.

It is also noticeable into the Editor when you put a `Tree` control node into the 2D viewport, and that you zoom-in and zoom-out with the mouse wheel, you can see the background color of the `Tree` control node does not always fit the bounding box. 

Here are some screen shots showing the behavior at different aspect ratio :

![godot_20150409_1427_bug_control_tree_clipping_error_with_strech_mode_2d_aspect_keep_00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/7066804/6e7a35b0-dec6-11e4-8578-276e24e8383a.jpg)

![godot_20150409_1427_bug_control_tree_clipping_error_with_strech_mode_2d_aspect_keep_01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/7066808/748b3dbe-dec6-11e4-9f94-2bf2b1c253ff.jpg)

![godot_20150409_1427_bug_control_tree_clipping_error_with_strech_mode_2d_aspect_keep_02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/7066812/7af78e6e-dec6-11e4-851e-dfafaea4bcc9.jpg)

data.title: File Format '0.1.1' is too new! For Android
data.body:
Running from latest commit, project works fine on mac osx but on porting it to Android.
"File Format '0.1.1' is too new! Please upgrade to a a new engine version"

I got it to work by saving the scene as  XML and manually changing the <resource_file version="1.1"> to <resource_file version="1.0">.
But that's not the ideal way, hence the issue generated.

data.title: Jerky movement of KinematicBody2D and PathFollow2D
data.body:
KinematicBody2D and PathFollow2D nodes (probably other higer level nodes too) jitter in movement.
Moving a simple sprite through set_pos works much smoother. In both cases FPS are quite constant.
The issue seems quite common, even visible on some youtube tutorials.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aMzPvouGqpM&feature=youtu.be&t=8m8s

OS: Linux Mint 17 64Bit, Windows 7 64Bit, OSX 
GPU Driver: Nvidia binary blobb and nouveau (only tested myself on linux, have no access to AMD hardware)

Example projects and further information can be found here:
path follow: 
http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1815
kinematicbody: 
http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1607&sid=6f044f9ee42cda9278a572e34c5d34c7

data.title: Auto-cast from float to integer
data.body:
Hello, it could be useful to be able to use a float without decimals as an integer in two cases :
- modulo -> Error with 5.0 % 2
- Dictionary keys -> my_dict[5] != my_dict[5.0]

These errors are hard to find/avoid in a top-level language.

data.body:
It would be great to have a list of scenes, they don't have to be opened, just for faster access.
Thanks.
